Rewarding

review_title: Work hard, play hard and get rewarded
years_at_company: Work hard, play hard and get rewarded
pros:
Best commission scheme in London
Good salary that will increase and increase the better you perform
Good career progression
Great team, close nit and make you feel very welcome - lots of banter
Great environment
cons: Expected to work a lot of hours but at the end of the day that's what recruitment is about and that is how you make CASH

review_title: Great culture, that promotes success and progression!
years_at_company: Great culture, that promotes success and progression!
pros:
- Your hard work really pays off... the commission scheme is certainly the best I have seen in London!!
- Everybody gets on and work well together which is unusual in any firm.
- Regular social events ranging from activity days to nights out to top restaurant/club
- Given a lot of responsibility and freedom with NO KPI's!
cons: Need to put in the hours and a lot hard work to reap the rewards.. success doesn't come easy!

pros: Great ethics to grow the business, everyone shares the same goal, very exciting times for RJ.
cons:
I would like to see more team building events
Long hours but it's expected in this industry
advice_to_mgmt: Continue to provide support to the teams, allowing them to grow and thrive, making it a great place to be.

pros:
- Nice friendly atmosphere.
- Lots of opportunity to carve your own niche in the market.
- Hands on training from senior consultants.
- Clear company direction and expansion plans.
cons:
- Expect to work long hour if you want to succeed.
- Not the most structured training programme - be prepared to be given a lot of responsibility over your own work and development.
- Not enough toilets

pros:
- Provided all the tools necessary to assist you in starting a successful career in recruitment
- Detailed training videos for all new-starters
- Great working environment
- Good scope for progression, provided you continue to perform
cons:
- Often it can be hard to find the right market for you to work (although this is more a reflection of recruitment on the whole)
- If you're looking for an easy job, this is not a position for slackers, or those who are not team-players
advice_to_mgmt: - Make sure no-one is getting micro-managed

pros: Flexible working environment. Fun place to work with a great atmosphere. Innovative. Managed to diversify to stay ahead of competitors. Senior management are willing to give up time to help train and motivate staff.
cons: There are no obvious cons at present. This is the best company I have worked for so far in my career.
advice_to_mgmt: Keep it up, and remain accessible to more junior staff. It helps keep the sales floor motivated and ensures great performance.

pros:
Great training videos and on the desk learning for new recruiters
Fantastic career development opportunities - I have been here less than a year and already had my first promotion and pay rise
Fun environment
Real opportunities to make money
cons: No cons at the moment - maybe more social events
advice_to_mgmt: Arrange more social events so that new people can get to know each other

review_title: Leave your morals at the doorstep
years_at_company: Leave your morals at the doorstep
pros: Good starting job out of university if you want experience. Just don't expect clear management and for the company to have integrity
cons:
Do anything to make a sale
Fake job adverts
Calling candidates looking for a job to find out the companies that have interviewed them, in order to find potential clients
Quantity over quality
Large staff turnover
Long hours

review_title: Really care about doing a good job
years_at_company: Really care about doing a good job
pros:
Hands on MD that cares about every individual doing well in the firm
Plenty of tools and resources
Realistic targets and goals
cons:
Tough industry to recruit in
Not enough collaboration between consultants

pros: Strong client base. Given tools to recruit. Commission scheme is very good.
cons: I can't think of anything at present.

pros:
- Radley James immediately stood out to me as being a niche size firm with a hardworking ethic and rewards.
- I started at Radley James straight out of University with no experience in recruitment at all
- From day one I was made to feel welcome as part of the RJ community and received first class training and mentoring.
- Quick career progression, as I turned to a full Consultant in just over 6 months.
- Even in my first few months I was pivotal to adding new clients.
- The friendly sales floor environment and helpful onsite compliance, operations and finance teams makes working at Radley James effortless and highly enjoyable.
cons: Long working hours which can be expected

pros:
Collaborative environment!
Fun and Fast Paced!
cons: None, as long as you are prepared to work very hard!
advice_to_mgmt: Keep listening to your employees, they are on the front line!

pros: I started work at Radley James 4 years ago after graduating from University and it has been the best experience of my life. I have been promoted 4 times since working here, with dramatic basic salary increase. On top of that, this company has one of the best commission structures in the industry, (no desk fee's!!!) which has meant that yearly earnings have exceeded £70,000 for the last two years (not bad for someone that only graduated four years ago). The environment is fun and everyone is made to feel welcome, working as a team is something we excel at!
cons: Office shuts at 10pm so I cant work later

pros:
The business has grown at a remarkable and impressive rate since inception in 2009, this is down to the experience and ability of the team and the excellent management who are supportive, hands on recruitment professionals. The company offer:
Excellent earning potential.
Delivery focused.
Promote diversity.
Ethical "Best Practice" recruitment processes.
Provide the tools required to support the impressive client list.
Not a KPI environment.
cons: I don't have any cons to mention.

pros:
Great coaching
Great commission structure
Good work ethic
Fun environment - people open to having a laugh
cons:
Not many incentives apart from good commission structure
Not many female employees
advice_to_mgmt: Make sure to not hire average people - in terms of wanting to work hard and achieve

pros:
Best commission structure on the market.
Great work/social life balance
Fully Stocked Bar
Brand New Office
cons:
Long hours, that''s just recruitment!
Bar sometimes runs out on a Friday
Sometimes it can be LOUD, but its a sales floor
advice_to_mgmt: Keep the work hard, play hard approach. Incentives are great but keep the commission structure as it is.

pros:
• Vibrant office atmosphere. Hard working, but fun.
• Good access to Senior Management. Really feel they listen to views and opinions and act on them.
• Great office environment and location in the centre of London.
• Encouraged to learn, and take on new responsibilities.
cons: • No obvious cons at present. More regular meetings to keep employees abreast on how the company as a whole is performing would be great.

pros:
+ hands-on management culture & training
+ world-class client base
+ excellent opportunities to develop very quickly
cons: + very fast paced & competitive industry & sector - so not for everyone!

pros:
Radley James is a brilliant place to work for a number of reasons. Some of which include:

You feel like you are important as an individual to the success of the organisation.
Senior staff are always there to help you and provide guidance/support when necessary.
You are given the opportunity to grow and succeed as a consultant without unnecessary KPI targets.
 You feel motivated to do well - rewarded well and valued as an employee.
International opportunities.
If you are prepared to work hard you will do well.

I actually left RJ due to geographical reasons but when found out they were opening up in Scotland, well lets just say it was an easy decision to come back.
cons: Nothing I can think of ...
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you are doing!

review_title: Radley James is the best recruitment firm that I have ever worked for...
years_at_company: Radley James is the best recruitment firm that I have ever worked for...
pros:
1. Senior management are always accessible and willing to help
2. Creativity and 'thinking outside the box' is actively encouraged
3. Great office location in heart of London
4. Diverse team and staff
5. Regular interaction with international offices
cons: There are none for me at present.

pros: No KPI's, Adult environment, Superb culture, good direction and superb opportunity to genuinely progress your career
cons: None to be honest, unlike a lot of agencies
